page.title: 11INTRODUCTION/ABBOTSKERSWELL
page.content: Abbotskerswell is a small rural community with about 1500 residents, lying about 3 km from Newton Abbot.It has a church dedicated to St. Mary the Virgin.It is an Anglican Church, about 4OO years old, with one of the oldest lych gates in England. The church was built at various times, mostly before 16OO. The earliest part of the church dates back to 14OO. The Village Hall was built 1O years ago in 1975. It now houses many public meetings including the Badminton and Youth clubs. New buildings are sited in Wilton Way, Manor Road and St.Mary's Close,though there are many thatched cottages.There are two general stores, a hairdressers and a Post Office. The only farm is a dairy and meat farm. The school is a County Primary School with a swimming pool,field and four classrooms.
